alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 14 at 5:11AM PST until December 15 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING NEAR BEACHES AND HEADLANDS... * WHAT...Southeast winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Beaches and headlands along the North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds may blow down trees and power lines. Scattered power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For coastal communities away from the immediate beaches, gusts 35 to 45 mph are expected.
info.instruction: Residents should take action soon to tie down loose objects in yards. Some damage can be expected from the high winds, especially to signs, tree limbs and power lines. Power outages are possible. Drive with extreme caution in the warning area and be prepared for flying debris.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast
